intro: Weigeltia albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower weigelt, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Lythraceae family, which includes plants such as poinsettias and crape myrtles. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite, oval-shaped, and have a smooth texture. Weigeltia albiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands.
